variants.description: A 10-round box magazine for the SIG Sauer P320.  Also compatible with its derivative pistols, the M17 and M18.

//: length 4.75 in, width 0.875 in, height 1.275 in, raw 86.84 ml, trim 2%
//2: 10-round magazines are for the civilian market in states where magazine capacity is restricted (i.e., a civilian cannot legally own a magazine that can hold more than X rounds); these have the same dimensions as a 17-rounder for the full-sized M17/M18, and are restricted by their construction, not length; https://www.sigtalk.com/threads/p320-magazine-size-carry-10rd-compared-to-15-or-17rd-magazines.406582/post-5720696; there are compact 15-round magazines for P320 that have a 10-round counterpart, but those are for compact-frame pistols (i.e., smaller than full-sized P320 and related models); we assume there's no difference in the weight of the empty magazine
//weight: there is a mismatch between stated weight of magazine (2.97 oz = 84.198 g), and the difference between the weight of the gun with 17-round magazine inside and the weight of the empty gun (29.98 oz - 26.9 oz = 3.08 oz = 87.317 g); moreover, different sources cite different weights for the gun with an empty standard-issue (17-round) magazine; Wikipedia: 29.4 oz = 833.48 g / https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SIG_Sauer_M17; SSSF: 29.5 oz = 836.31 g / https://sssfonline.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/2019-SASP-Approved-Stock-Service-Pistol-Weights.pdf; we stick to the Sig Sauer numbers and err on the side of caution by choosing the higher weight
